thread.section_title: Arts and Entertainment coverage for all ages and interests - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: Jane’s Addiction revives ‘Ritual’
thread.title_full: Jane’s Addiction revives ‘Ritual’ - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Aidin Vaziri
title: Jane’s Addiction revives ‘Ritual’
text:
Photo: Janette Pellegrini, Getty Images Dave Navarro and Perry Farrell of Jane's Addiction perform during the 2013 Rockstar Energy UPROAR Festival at Nikon at Jones Beach Theater on August 18, 2013 in Wantagh, New York. (Photo by Janette Pellegrini/Getty Images) Dave Navarro and Perry Farrell of Jane's Addiction perform during...
Jane’s Addiction imploded shortly after releasing its second studio album, the controversy-baiting “Ritual de lo Habitual.” So it only makes sense that the tattooed Los Angeles rockers (and erstwhile reality show stars) have decided to mark the 25th anniversary of its release by performing it from beginning to end. Never mind that revisiting songs like “Been Caught Stealing” and “Three Days” could spell doom for the future of the band that in 2011 released “The Great Escape Artist.” Dave Navarro and Perry Farrell of Jane's Addiction perform during the 2013 Rockstar Energy UPROAR Festival at Nikon at Jones Beach Theater on August 18, 2013 in Wantagh, New York. (Photo by Janette Pellegrini/Getty Images) Dave Navarro and Perry Farrell of Jane's Addiction perform during...
Jane’s Addiction imploded shortly after releasing its second studio album, the controversy-baiting “Ritual de lo Habitual.” So it only makes sense that the tattooed Los Angeles rockers (and erstwhile reality show stars) have decided to mark the 25th anniversary of its release by performing it from beginning to end. Never mind that revisiting songs like “Been Caught Stealing” and “Three Days” could spell doom for the future of the band that in 2011 released “The Great Escape Artist.”
